alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 1:56PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Monroe County through 245 PM CDT... At 156 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 6 miles northwest of Uriah, or 10 miles west of Frisco City. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Uriah. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
